io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.model

Class StockDisplayModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.craigmiller160.mvp.core.AbstractPropertyModel
      • io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.model.StockDisplayModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    @ThreadSafe
public class StockDisplayModel
extends io.craigmiller160.mvp.core.AbstractPropertyModel
    A JavaBean bound property model defining the value of the stock currently being displayed in the program. Contains separate properties for both the stock itself and the stock's history.

    The stock history list parameter here is an AbstractList, rather than a List, to facilitate the reflective setter

    THREAD SAFETY: This class is completely thread safe. The only potential area it could be compromised is with the AbstractStock reference. Its reference leaks out via the getter method and the PropertyChangeEvent fired by its setter. If a thread-safe implementation of this abstract class is used, there will be no risk. Consult the documentation for the stock class implementation being used by this program to determine if additional locking is needed.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    craig
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
